item.title: W.L. add a quote by Saemund Sigfusson
item.description: "He is happy, who in himself possesses fame and wit while living; for bad counsels have oft been received from another's breast." -- Saemund Sigfusson

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Saemund Sigfusson
item.description: "The mind only knows what lies near the heart, that alone is conscious of our affections. No disease is worse to a sensible man than not to be content with himself." -- Saemund Sigfusson

item.title: W.L. add a quote by L. Ron Hubbard
item.description: "Learning locked in mildewed books is of little use to anyone and therefore of no value unless it can be used." -- L. Ron Hubbard

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "It is from the Bible that man has learned cruelty, rapine, and murder; for the belief of a cruel God makes a cruel man." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Jim Carroll
item.description: "That, I realized, is the great beauty of dreams: the devil may inevitably find a way to jerk you off, but you can always wake up before he makes you cum." -- Jim Carroll

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Jim Carroll
item.description: "Violence is so terribly fast . . . the most perverse thing about the movies is the way they portray it in slow motion, allowing it to be something sensuous . . . the viewer's lips slightly wet as the scene plays out. Violence is nothing like that. It is lightning fast, chaotic, and totally intangible. " -- Jim Carroll

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Victor E. Marsden
item.description: "True force makes no terms with any right, not even with that of God;" -- Victor E. Marsden

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Scott Weiland
item.description: "I could hide in the calm of the eye of the storm and never blow away." -- Scott Weiland

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The truth is seldom welcome, especially at dinner." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Mary C Miller
item.description: "The more complex the strategy, the less truth there is in it." -- Mary C Miller

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Paul Grimsley
item.description: "let me put on my Sherlock Holmes deer-stalker hat and think why else a junkie might be shivering!" -- Paul Grimsley

item.title: W.L. add a quote by Damien Echols
item.description: "Faith is nothing more than a watered-down attempt to accept someone elseâ€™s insight as your own. Belief is the psychic equivalent of an article of second-hand clothing, worn out and passed down. " -- Damien Echols
